interconnection.net_metering_details: Montana has net metering for systems up to 50 kW. Credits at retail rate. NorthWestern Energy is the dominant utility. Monthly rollover, annual true-up at avoided cost. Co-ops and municipal utilities have varying policies.

special_considerations.hoa_restrictions: Montana has a solar easement statute (MCA 70-17-301). Limited protection against HOA restrictions.
special_considerations.historic_districts: Historic districts in Butte, Helena, and other mining/frontier towns. Montana SHPO reviews solar in National Register districts.
special_considerations.wind_load_requirements: High wind areas in eastern Montana plains and mountain passes. Design wind speeds 90-130 mph depending on location.
special_considerations.snow_load_requirements: Significant snow loads in mountain areas and western Montana (30-100+ psf ground snow load). Eastern plains moderate (20-40 psf). Structural engineering review commonly required.

licensing.license_type: Licensed electrician required. General contractor license required for structural work. No dedicated solar contractor license.

notes: Montana has a small but growing solar market. The state offers a property tax exemption for solar and an alternative energy investment tax credit. Net metering at retail rate supports residential solar economics. NorthWestern Energy territory covers most of the state. High snow loads and extreme winter weather are significant design considerations. The state's large geographic area and rural character mean permitting practices vary significantly between jurisdictions.
